#summary DeskNFC - Download, install and use

= Introduction =
DeskNFC is a KDE4 plasmoid which offer NFC content access.

You can see connected NFC devices, tags which are in field and tags content if available.

DeskNFC is written in C++, depends on KDE4 libs (Qt4) and use [nfcd] D-Bus bindings.

= Requirements =
To run DeskNFC, you will need
  * [http://www.libnfc.org/documentation/installation libnfc] (>= 1.3.4);
  * [http://code.google.com/p/nfc-tools/wiki/libfreefare libfreefare] (>= r270);
  * [http://code.google.com/p/libndef/source/browse/trunk/INSTALL libndef] (>= 1.0.1).

To build DeskNFC, you need to have on your system:
  * CMake (>= 2.6);
  * KDE4 libs (>= 4.3);
  * and development files of run requirements.

= Build =
{{{
svn checkout http://nfc-tools.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/desknfc desknfc
cd desknfc
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr
make
}}}

= Test =
Once these commands succeed, be sure that NFCd is launched and :
{{{
plasmoidviewer desknfc
}}}

= Usage =
If it works fine, you can install it:
{{{
sudo make install
}}}

An put it on your desktop from the plasmoid adding menu of KDE4.

Note: NFCd is needed all along the execution of DeskNFC.
